summary: Ernestine G. Johnson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is mentioned in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on payroll indicates she was a staff member during the SCAS investigation.
significance: Ernestine G. Johnson's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although her specific role and contribution are not detailed in the provided documents.
